maml:description.maml:para: The Get-AzureRMManagementGroup cmdlet Gets all or a specific Management Group.

maml:Description.maml:para: Management Group Id
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Expand the output to list the children of the management group
Recursively list the children of the management group
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Expand the output to list the children of the management group
Management Group Id
Recursively list the children of the management group
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get all Management Groups
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmManagementGroup
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroup Type : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups Name : TestGroup TenantId : 6b2064b9-34bd-46e6-9092-52f2dd5f7fc0 DisplayName : TestGroupDisplayName
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroupChild Type : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups Name : TestGroupChild TenantId : 6b2064b9-34bd-46e6-9092-52f2dd5f7fc0 DisplayName : TestGroupChildDisplayName

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get specific Management Group
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmManagementGroup -GroupName TestGroup
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroup Type : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups Name : TestGroup TenantId : 6b2064b9-34bd-46e6-9092-52f2dd5f7fc0 DisplayName : TestGroupDisplayName UpdatedTime : 2/1/2018 11:16:12 AM UpdatedBy : 64360beb-ffb4-43a8-9314-01aa34db95a9 ParentId : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroupParent ParentDisplayName :

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get specific Management Group and first level of hierarchy
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $reponse = Get-AzureRmManagementGroup -GroupName TestGroupParent -Expand PS C:\> $response
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroupParent Type : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups Name : TestGroupParent TenantId : 6b2064b9-34bd-46e6-9092-52f2dd5f7fc0 DisplayName : TestGroupParent UpdatedTime : 2/1/2018 11:15:46 AM UpdatedBy : 64360beb-ffb4-43a8-9314-01aa34db95a9 ParentId : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/6b2064b9-34bd-46e6-9092-52f2dd5f7fc0 ParentDisplayName : 6b2064b9-34bd-46e6-9092-52f2dd5f7fc0 Children : {TestGroup1DisplayName, TestGroup2DisplayName}
PS C:\> $response.Children[0]
ChildType : /managementGroup ChildId : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroup1 DisplayName : TestGroup1DisplayName Children :

dev:remarks.maml:para: With the `Expand` flag, one can navigate through the `Children` array and get details for each child. For example, `Children[0]` will give details for the group with display name `TestGroup1DisplayName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Get specific Management Group and all levels of hiearchy

maml:description.maml:para: The New-AzureRMManagementGroup cmdlet creates a management group.

maml:Description.maml:para: Management Group Id
Display Name of the management group
Parent Id of the management group
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Management Group Id
Display Name of the management group
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Parent Object
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Display Name of the management group
Management Group Id
Parent Id of the management group
Parent Object
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a Management Group
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-AzureRmManagementGroup -GroupName "TestGroup"
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroup Type : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups Name : TestGroup TenantId : 14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30 DisplayName : TestGroup UpdatedTime : 2/1/2018 11:06:27 AM UpdatedBy : 14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30 ParentId : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30 ParentDisplayName : 14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creation of a new group with `DisplayName` and `ParentId` set to `null`. The `DisplayName` will be same as the `GroupName` and the parent of the group will be the tenant.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Create a Management Group with a display name
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-AzureRmManagementGroup -GroupName "TestGroup" -DisplayName "TestGroupDisplayName"
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroup Type : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups Name : TestGroup TenantId : 14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30 DisplayName : TestGroup UpdatedTime : 2/1/2018 11:06:27 AM UpdatedBy : 14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30 ParentId : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30 ParentDisplayName : 14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30

dev:remarks.maml:para: In this case, the parent of the group will be the tenant and the `DisplayName` will be set to the value given.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Create a Management Group with a parent and a display name
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-AzureRmManagementGroup -GroupName "TestGroup" -DisplayName "TestGroupDisplayName" -ParentId "/providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroupParent"
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroup Type : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups Name : TestGroup TenantId : 14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30 DisplayName : TestGroupDisplayName UpdatedTime : 2/1/2018 11:16:12 AM UpdatedBy : 14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30 ParentId : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroupParent ParentDisplayName : TestGroupParent

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Create a Management Group with a parent (using a parent object)
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $parentObject = Get-AzureRmManagementGroup -GroupName "TestGroupParent" PS C:\> New-AzureRmManagementGroup -GroupName "TestGroup" -ParentObject $parentObject
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroup Type : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups Name : TestGroup TenantId : 14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30 DisplayName : TestGroupDisplayName UpdatedTime : 2/1/2018 11:16:12 AM UpdatedBy : 14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30 ParentId : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroupParent ParentDisplayName : TestGroupParent

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a Subscription to a Management Group.
The New-AzureRMManagementGroupSubscription cmdlet adds a Subscription to a Management Group.

maml:Description.maml:para: Management Group Id
Subscription Id of the subscription associated witht the management
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Return `true` on successful execution
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Management Group Id
Return `true` on successful execution
Subscription Id of the subscription associated witht the management
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Update a Management Group's Display Name
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Update-AzureRMManagementGroup -Group "TestGroup" -DisplayName "New Display Name"
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroup Type : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups Name : TestGroup TenantId : 6b2064b9-34bd-46e6-9092-52f2dd5f7fc0 DisplayName : New Display Name UpdatedTime : 2/1/2018 12:03:37 PM UpdatedBy : 64360beb-ffb4-43a8-9314-01aa34db95a9 ParentId : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/6b2064b9-34bd-46e6-9092-52f2dd5f7fc0 ParentDisplayName : 6b2064b9-34bd-46e6-9092-52f2dd5f7fc0

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Update a Management Group's Parent
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Update-AzureRMManagementGroup -Group "TestGroup" -ParentId "/providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroupParent"
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroup Type : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups Name : TestGroup TenantId : 6b2064b9-34bd-46e6-9092-52f2dd5f7fc0 DisplayName : TestGroup UpdatedTime : 2/1/2018 12:03:37 PM UpdatedBy : 64360beb-ffb4-43a8-9314-01aa34db95a9 ParentId : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroupParent ParentDisplayName : TestGroupParent

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Update a Management Group by piping PSManagementGroup Object
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmManagementGroup -GroupName "TestGroup" | Update-AzureRMManagementGroup -DisplayName "TestDisplayName" -ParentId "/providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroupParent"
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroup Type : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups Name : TestGroup TenantId : 6b2064b9-34bd-46e6-9092-52f2dd5f7fc0 DisplayName : TestDisplayName UpdatedTime : 2/1/2018 12:03:37 PM UpdatedBy : 64360beb-ffb4-43a8-9314-01aa34db95a9 ParentId : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroupParent ParentDisplayName : TestGroupParent

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Update a Management Group's parent using the ParentObject
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $parentObject = Get-AzureRmManagementGroup -GroupName "TestGroupParent" PS C:\> Update-AzureRmManagementGroup -GroupName "TestGroup" -ParentObject $parentObject
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroup Type : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups Name : TestGroup TenantId : 14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30 DisplayName : TestGroupDisplayName UpdatedTime : 2/1/2018 11:16:12 AM UpdatedBy : 14307de0-5e6f-46cf-b2ba-64a062964d30 ParentId : /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/TestGroupParent ParentDisplayName : TestGroupParent
